roleset.name: combine, mix, cause to combine, combine or mix together
roleset.note: COMBINE-V NOTES: Probably this verb should not show both ergative and passiveformations; I think this is an(other) inconsistency in treebank. (from combine.01-v)
CONGLOMERATION-N NOTES: Based on the stratified corpus. Comparison to combine.01. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from conglomeration.01-n)
COMBINATION-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'combine'. VN class mix-22.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from combination.01-n)

roles.note: If both ingredients are lumped together, use arg 1. (from combination.01-n)

example.name: separate ingredients, and agent
example.text: The plan still calls for LIN to combine its cellular telephone properties with BellSouth's and to spin off its broadcasting operations.

example.name: separate ingredients, passivized
example.text: [GMAC profits]-1 are combined *trace*-1 with earnings from the rest of GM's operations and attributed to the company's traditional common stock.
example.arg: with earnings from the rest of GM's operations

example.name: ergative, one ingredient
example.text: Mr. Bryant and other analysts hope all those moves will combine to help Tandy's results improve in the important Christmas quarter.
example.arg: to help Tandy's results improve in the important Christmas quarter

example.name: ergative, two ingredients
example.text: Sterling's firm tone, combined with a steady opening on Wall Street, also tempted some investors to come back to the market, dealers said.
example.arg: with a steady opening on Wall Street

example.name: with end product
example.text: Further, he said, an internal reorganization *trace* *trace* to combine several divisions into the Information Technology Group is expected to affect fourth-quarter results by an undisclosed amount.
a conglomeration of regional lymph node metasteses

example.name: What to do if both ingredients are lumped together
example.text: The combination of traditional Taiwanese and contemporary factors
example.arg: of traditional Taiwanese and contemporary factors

example.name: Two ingredients treed in seperate PPs
example.text: The combination of solid loan growth with tight expense control

example.name: Three ingredients; one PP
example.text: some combination of drug, alcohol, and mental problems.
example.arg: of drug, alcohol, and mental problems.

example.name: Arg 0
example.text: the network's inabliity to match a Time-Warner combination
